title: Crystal-Powered Train Station Adventure #7
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Station Control Room
rooms.description: A dimly lit control room filled with brass gauges, copper pipes, and flickering crystal displays. The walls are lined with technical diagrams showing the station's crystal power grid. Emergency lights cast an amber glow over dusty control panels. Through a grimy window, you can see the darkened train platform below.

items.name: main control desk
items.description: A large desk covered in switches, dials, and indicator lights. Three drawers are built into the front.

items.name: crystal power manual
items.description: A worn technical manual with diagrams of crystal configurations
items.text: CRYSTAL POWER SYSTEMS - Aurora Station: Power levels by crystal type: Red Crystal = 3 units, Green Crystal = 5 units, Blue Crystal = 7 units. Total system capacity: 15 units. Chief Engineer: Marcus Brightstone. Remember: combine power levels in order of wavelength (red, green, blue) for emergency access.

items.name: copper key
items.description: A key made of polished copper with crystal inlays

items.name: locked supply cabinet
items.description: A tall metal cabinet with a copper lock mechanism

items.name: red power crystal
items.description: A glowing red crystal that pulses with energy

items.name: station master's log
items.description: A leather-bound logbook with recent entries
items.text: Final Entry: Power failure in the main crystal chamber. I've hidden the green crystal in the wall safe and the blue crystal in the equipment locker. Only someone who knows our station's true name (Aurora Station), our power source (crystal energy), and our chief engineer (Marcus Brightstone) can access the chamber. The last train departs at midnight!

items.name: wall safe
items.description: A small safe embedded in the wall behind a technical diagram

items.name: green power crystal
items.description: A glowing green crystal humming with energy

items.name: equipment locker
items.description: A tall locker containing maintenance tools and supplies

items.name: blue power crystal
items.description: A glowing blue crystal crackling with energy

items.name: maintenance note
items.description: A hastily written note on yellowed paper
items.text: Reminder: The crystal chamber door requires three security answers. Station name: Aurora Station. Power type: Crystal Energy. Chief Engineer: Marcus Brightstone. Don't forget!

items.name: reinforced chamber door
items.description: A heavy door with brass fittings leading to the crystal power chamber. A security panel displays three questions.

password_questions.question: What is the name of this station?
password_questions.hint: Check the technical manual and station logs

password_questions.question: What powers this station?
password_questions.hint: The maintenance note mentions the power type

password_questions.question: Who is the chief engineer?
password_questions.hint: The technical manual lists the chief engineer's name

rooms.name: Crystal Power Chamber
rooms.description: A circular chamber with a domed ceiling covered in glowing crystal veins. In the center stands a large brass pedestal with three empty crystal slots arranged in a triangle - red, green, and blue. Copper conduits run along the walls, currently dark and inactive. The air tingles with latent magical energy.

items.name: main power pedestal
items.description: A brass pedestal with three crystal slots labeled with colored symbols
items.text: POWER RESTORATION PROTOCOL: Insert all three power crystals (red, green, blue) to restore station power and unlock platform access. Warning: Crystals must be collected before insertion.

items.name: crystal energy display
items.description: A glass panel showing crystal energy flow diagrams
items.text: Crystal Energy Network: Red Crystal (3 units) → Green Crystal (5 units) → Blue Crystal (7 units) = Total System Power (15 units). All three crystals required for full restoration.

items.name: copper power conduits
items.description: Intricate copper pipes and wires connecting the pedestal to the station's power grid

items.name: platform access door
items.description: A large door with crystal-powered locks leading to the departure platform. It requires full power restoration to open.

rooms.name: Departure Platform
rooms.description: You've made it! The platform is now brilliantly lit by glowing crystal lamps. A magnificent steam train with crystal-powered engines sits at the platform, its brass fittings gleaming. Steam hisses from the pipes, and the crystals in the engine glow with rainbow light. The conductor waves from the cabin, ready to depart.

items.name: crystal-powered train
items.description: A beautiful locomotive with crystal energy cores visible through brass-framed windows. The engine hums with power, ready for departure.

items.name: station clock
items.description: A large clock showing it's nearly midnight - the last departure time
items.text: The clock reads 11:58 PM. The last train departs in 2 minutes!

items.name: train conductor
items.description: A friendly conductor in a crisp uniform, gesturing for you to board

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You've restored power to Aurora Station and caught the last crystal-powered train! As the train pulls away from the platform, the station's lights blaze brilliantly behind you. The crystal engines hum smoothly as you speed through the night toward your destination. You win!
